perturbation.original_text:
5.7     Payment  Schedule.  The  parties  shall  make  such payments within
thirty (30) days of the end of each calendar quarter for the Advertising Revenue
invoiced  during  such  calendar  quarter.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.7     Payment  Schedule.  The  parties  shall  make  such payments within
ninety (90) days of the end of each calendar quarter for the Advertising Revenue
invoiced  during  such  calendar  quarter.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by changing the payment deadline from 30 days to 90 days. This conflicts with the original 30-day term stated in the contract's earlier payment clause, creating uncertainty as to which term should be enforced. This also impacts the audit rights in clause 5.8 since the audit period is based off of 'statement' for two years after the termination or expiration of this contract or after the final payment.

perturbation.original_text:
Payment  Terms. All fees will be paid on or before fifteen (15) days
after  the  end of the  month  in  which  the  party  has  received  payment
perturbation.changed_text:
Payment  Terms. All fees will be paid on or before forty-five (45) days
after  the  end of the  month  in  which  the  party  has  received  payment
perturbation.explanation: The modification introduces a contradiction by stating that all fees will be paid within 45 days after the end of the month. This directly conflicts with the payment schedule specified in 5.7, creating uncertainty regarding the correct payment deadline. It causes ambiguity concerning when payment is due.

perturbation.original_text:
SpinRecords.com agrees to keep accurate books of account
and records at its principal place of business covering all Advertising Revenues
and  associated  commissions.  Upon reasonable notice of not less than seven (7)
business  days,  but in no event more than once per year (unless the immediately
preceding  audit  showed a material underpayment), NETTAXI shall have the right,
subject  to  suitable  confidentiality  measures,  to  cause  a certified public
accountant  to  inspect those portions of the books of account and records which
relate  to  the royalties owed NETTAXI, to confirm that the correct amount owing
NETTAXI  under this Agreement has been paid. SpinRecords.com shall maintain such
books of account and records which support each statement for at least two years
after  the termination or expiration of this contract or after the final payment
made  by  SpinRecords.com  to  NETTAXI,  whichever  is  later.
perturbation.changed_text:
SpinRecords.com agrees to keep accurate books of account
and records at its principal place of business covering all Advertising Revenues
and  associated  commissions.  Upon reasonable notice of not less than thirty (30)
business  days,  but in no event more than three times per year, NETTAXI shall have the right,
subject  to  suitable  confidentiality  measures,  to  cause  a certified public
accountant  to  inspect those portions of the books of account and records which
relate  to  the royalties owed NETTAXI, to confirm that the correct amount owing
NETTAXI  under this Agreement has been paid. SpinRecords.com shall maintain such
books of account and records which support each statement for at least one year
after  the termination or expiration of this contract or after the final payment
made  by  SpinRecords.com  to  NETTAXI,  whichever  is  later.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text conflicts with the original text by altering audit frequency and the retention period for financial records. Originally, NETTAXI could audit with seven days' notice, and the records needed to be kept for two years; now, the notice is thirty days, audits can happen three times a year, and records only need to be kept for one year. This directly contradicts the original terms, creating confusion and potential disputes regarding audit rights and financial record-keeping responsibilities.
